version-semantic.description:
The API version field should follow
[semantic versioning](https://semver.org/#semantic-versioning-specification-semver).
version-semantic.message: Specs should follow semantic versioning. {{value}} is not a valid version.

allowed-date-format.description: String properties with the date format must end in Date.

allowed-integer-format-oas3.description:
To improve interoperability, integer and number formats are constrained
to a shared subset.  See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
allowed-integer-format-oas3.message: Type format is "{{value}}", expected one of [int32, int64]. {{path}}

allowed-integer-format.description:
To improve interoperability, integer and number formats are constrained
to a shared subset.  See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
allowed-integer-format.message: Type format is "{{value}}", expected one of [int32, int64]. {{path}}

allowed-number-format-oas3.description:
To improve interoperability, integer and number formats are constrained
to a shared subset. See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
allowed-number-format-oas3.message: Type format is "{{value}}", expected one of [decimal32, decimal64, decimal128, float, double]. {{path}}

allowed-number-format.description:
To improve interoperability, integer and number formats are constrained
to a shared subset. See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
allowed-number-format.message: Type format is "{{value}}", expected one of [decimal32, decimal64, decimal128, float, double]. {{path}}

api-home-get.description: APIs root path MUST have a GET defined,.

array-boundaries-oas3.description: Array size should be limited to mitigate resource exhaustion attacks. This can be done using `maxItems` and `minItems`, like in the example below. You should ensure that the schema referenced in  `items` is constrained too.  If you delegate input validation to a library or framework, be sure to test it thoroughly and ensure that it verifies `maxItems`.
array-boundaries-oas3.message: Schema of type array must specify maxItems and minItems. {{path}} {{error}}

array-object-example-oas3.message: Did not expect {{property}}at {{path}}. Define example data on each property in the object instead

check-for-use-of-anyof.description: API Connect has a compatibility issue with the anyOf functionality. Avoid its use if reasonably possible.

check-for-use-of-oneof.description: API Connect has a compatibility issue with the oneOf functionality.

components-callbacks-camelcase.description: All callbacks should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-callbacks-camelcase.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the callback, eg. object -> Object.

components-examples-camelcase.description: All examples should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-examples-camelcase.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the example, eg. object -> Object.

components-headers-pascal-case.description: All responses should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-headers-pascal-case.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the definition, eg. object -> Object.

components-links-pascal-case.description: All links should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-links-pascal-case.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the link, eg. object -> Object.

components-parameters-camel-case.description: All parameter names should be lowerCamelCase
components-parameters-camel-case.message: {{value}} is not lowerCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the parameter, eg. ParameterName -> parameterName.

components-parameters-prefix-in-cookie.description: Parameters should be in a location matching the prefix (Cookie.)
components-parameters-prefix-in-cookie.message: {{value}} does not match the parameter prefix. {{description}}. Fix by assigning the correct in value, eg. header -> cookie.

components-parameters-prefix-in-header.description: Parameters should be in a location matching the prefix (Header.)
components-parameters-prefix-in-header.message: {{value}} does not match the parameter prefix. {{description}}. Fix by assigning the correct in value, eg. path -> header.

components-parameters-prefix-in-path.description: Parameters should be in a location matching the prefix (Path.)
components-parameters-prefix-in-path.message: {{value}} does not match the parameter prefix. {{description}}. Fix by assigning the correct in value, eg. header -> path.

components-parameters-prefix-in-query.description: Parameters should be in a location matching the prefix (Query.)
components-parameters-prefix-in-query.message: {{value}} does not match the parameter prefix. {{description}}. Fix by assigning the correct in value, eg. header -> query.

components-request-and-response-body-oas.description: Response and requestBody content schema $ref may only point to elements in the components object within document.

components-request-bodies-pascal-case.description: All definitions should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-request-bodies-pascal-case.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the definition, eg. object -> Object.

components-responses-pascal-case.description: All responses should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-responses-pascal-case.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the definition, eg. object -> Object.

components-security-schema-sigv4.description: Please provide a sigv4 for securitySchemes.

components-security-schemes-access-token.description: The access token is provided according to OIDC specifications

components-security-schemes-api-key.description: The client ID should be an apiKey in a header with the name X-api-key
components-security-schemes-api-key.message: {{property}} {{value}} does not match the value expected by the gateway.

components-security-schemes-api-secret.description: The client ID should be an apiKey in a header with the name X-api-secret
components-security-schemes-api-secret.message: {{property}} {{value}} does not match the value expected by the gateway.

components-security-schemes-basic.description: Consider a more secure alternative to HTTP Basic.
components-security-schemes-basic.message: HTTP Basic is a pretty insecure way to pass credentials around, please consider an alternative.

components-security-schemes-oauth-implic.description: The API must contain the security mechanism OAuth2 implicit
components-security-schemes-oauth-implic.message: The API must contain the security mechanism type OAuth2 implicit

components-security-schemes-oauth-passwo.description: The API must contain the security mechanism OAuth2 password
components-security-schemes-oauth-passwo.message: The API must contain the security mechanism  OAuth2 password

components-security-schemes-oauth.description: The API must contain the security mechanism OAuth2
components-security-schemes-oauth.message: The API must contain the security mechanism OAuth2

components-security-schemes-pascal-case.description: All security schemes should be named with UpperCamelCase
components-security-schemes-pascal-case.message: {{property}} is not UpperCamelCase. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the definition, eg. object -> Object.

components-security-schemes-prefix.description: Security schemes should be prefixed with their security type (Oidc., Csh. or Keys.)
components-security-schemes-prefix.message: {{property}} is not prefixed properly. {{description}}. Fix by renaming the parameter definition, eg. AccessToken -> Oidc.AccessToken.

response-body-standard-oas2.description: Ensure the get, put, and patch response body schemas are consistent.

constrained-additionalProperties.description:
By default, jsonschema allows additionalProperties. This means
that schema validators can be bypassed using further, unspecified
fields. While forbidding additionalProperties can create rigidity and hinder
the evolution of an API - eg making it hard to accept new parameters
or fields - it is possible that this flexibility can be used
to bypass the schema validator and force the application to process
unwanted information.
constrained-additionalProperties.message: Objects should not allow additionalProperties. Disable them with `additionalProperties: false` or constraint them.

consume-mime-type-oas2.description: FHIR mime-type must be application/fhir+(xml|json|turtle) or application/x-www-form-urlencoded for search endpoints

definitions-camelcase-alphanumeric.description: All YAML/JSON definitions MUST follow fields-camelCase and be ASCII alphanumeric characters or _ or $.
definitions-camelcase-alphanumeric.message: {{property}} MUST follow camelCase and be ASCII alphanumeric characters or _ or $.

definitions-example.description: Examples must be valid against their defined schema.

example-in-definitions-oas2.description: Examples must be valid against their defined schema.

definitions-properties-boolean-name-oas2.description: Checks for specific pattern in boolean property names.
definitions-properties-boolean-name-oas2.message: CONT03 Invalid property name for boolean type {{value}} (boolean may start with is or has and followed by capital letter or number to be more descriptive. expected isErased, hasStock)

definitions-properties-maxlength.description: Las propiedades de tipo cadena deben contener la propiedad maxLength (m√°xima longitud de cadena).
definitions-properties-maxlength.message: SWAG09 String-type properties MUST contain maxLength property (maximum length of string).

enum-values-upper-snake-case.message: Enum values should be in UPPER_SNAKE_CASE format
enum-values-upper-snake-case.description: SHOULD declare enum values using UPPER_SNAKE_CASE format [240]

example-exists-in-parameters.description: All models MUST have a valid example.
example-exists-in-parameters.message: {{ property }} MUST have a valid example.

hosts-https-only-oas2.description: ALL requests MUST go through `https` protocol only
hosts-https-only-oas2.message: Schemes MUST be https and no other value is allowed.

hosts-https-only-oas3.description: ALL requests MUST go through `https` protocol only
hosts-https-only-oas3.message: Servers MUST be https and no other protocol is allowed.

info-contact-email.description: API must have a contact email available.

info-contact-name.description: API must have a contact name available.

info-contact-url.description: API must have a contact url available.

info-contact.description: API must have a contact information available.

info-description-max-length.description: The description of the API must not be greater than 250 characters.

info-description-word-check.description: The API description must not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

info-description.description: API must have a description available.

info-license-name.description: API must have a license name applied.

info-license-url-apache.description: API must have an Apache license applied.

info-license-url-mit.description: API must have a MIT license applied.

info-license-url.description: API must have a license url applied.

info-license.description: API must have a license applied.

info-summary-max-length.description: The summary for the API should not be more than 50 characters in length.

info-summary-word-check.description: The API summary not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

info-summary.description: The API must have a summary applied.

info-terms-of-service.description: The API must have a terms of service applied.

info-title-in-kebab-case.message: Error in the format of the api title
info-title-in-kebab-case.description: The title of the API must be in kebab case.

info-title-max-length.description: The title of the API must not be more than 50 characters.

info-title-word-check.description: The title of the API must not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

info-title.description: The API must have a title.

info-version.description: The API must have version information applied.

info-x-api-id.message: API must have an unique identifier in x-api-id in #/info/x-api-id.
info-x-api-id.description:
The `#/info/x-api-id` field can be used to associate an identifier
to an API. This is useful to track an API even when its `#/info/title` changes.

info-x-summary.message: API MUST have an one-liner #/info/x-summary field containing a brief description.
info-x-summary.description: The `#/info/x-summary` can be used to specify a brief, one-liner description of your API: this is very useful for catalog purposes (eg. this can be shown as your API subtitle in catalogs and developer portals). In OAS3.1 you can use the standard `#/info/summary` field.

integer-format.description: Schema of type number or integer must specify a format to express the associated datatype, eg. `int32`, `int64`, You can express similar requirements using the `minimum` and `maximum` properties. See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
integer-format.message: Schema of type number or integer must specify a format. {{path}}

missing-ratelimit.description: Ratelimiting API preserves a service and limits attack scenario [see API4:2019 Lack of Resources & Rate Limiting](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security).

no-additionalProperties.description:
By default, jsonschema allows additionalProperties. This means
that schema validators can be bypassed using further, unspecified
fields. While forbidding additionalProperties can create rigidity and hinder
the evolution of an API - eg making it hard to accept new parameters
or fields - it is possible that this flexibility can be used
to bypass the schema validator and force the application to process
unwanted information.
no-additionalProperties.message: Objects should not allow additionalProperties. Disable them with `additionalProperties: false` or constraint them.

adidas-headers-no-x-headers.description: All HTTP headers SHOULD NOT include X- headers (https//tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6648).
adidas-headers-no-x-headers.message: HTTP headers SHOULD NOT include X- prefix.

no-default-additionalProperties.description:
By default, jsonschema allows additionalProperties. This means
that schema validators can be bypassed using further, unspecified
fields.  While forbidding additionalProperties can create rigidity and hinder
the evolution of an API - eg making it hard to accept new parameters
or fields - it is possible that this flexibility can be used
to bypass the schema validator and force the application to process
unwanted information.
no-default-additionalProperties.message: Objects should not allow additionalProperties. Disable them with `additionalProperties: false` or constraint them.

no-forbidden-headers.description:
OAS do not allow using the following HTTP headers in a specification
file: Authorization, Content-Type and Accept.
You MUST use the associate functionalities provided by OAS, instead.

no-http-basic.description: Consider a more secure alternative to HTTP Basic.
no-http-basic.message: HTTP Basic is a pretty insecure way to pass credentials around, please consider an alternative.

no-numeric-ids.description: Please avoid exposing IDs as an integer, UUIDs are preferred.

no-swagger-2.description: Swagger 2 files are not allowed. Use OpenAPI >= 3.0

no-x-headers-request.description: 'HTTP' headers SHOULD NOT start with 'X-' RFC6648.
no-x-headers-request.message: HTTP header '{{value}}' SHOULD NOT start with 'X-' in {{path}}

no-x-headers-response.description: 'HTTP' headers SHOULD NOT start with 'X-' RFC6648.
no-x-headers-response.message: HTTP response header SHOULD NOT start with 'X-' in {{path}}

no-x-headers.description: Please do not use headers with X-
no-x-headers.message: Headers cannot start with X-, so please find a new name for {{property}}. More: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6648

no-x-response-headers.description: Please do not use headers with X-
no-x-response-headers.message: Headers cannot start with X-, so please find a new name for {{property}}. More: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6648

number-boundaries.message: Schema of type number or integer must specify a maximum and a minimum. {{path}} {{error}}

number-format.description: Schema of type number or integer must specify a format to express the associated datatype, eg. `int32`, `int64`, ... You can express similar requirements using the `minimum` and `maximum` properties. See recommendation RAC_REST_FORMAT_004.
number-format.message: Schema of type number or integer must specify a format. {{path}}

operations-description-length.description: Operation description should be short and sweet, no full stops, and less than 20 characters

operations-description-words-check.description: Must not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

operations-operationids-camel-case.description: Operation IDs MUST be written in camelCase.

operations-operationids-kebab-case.description: Operation IDs MUST be written in kebab-case.

operations-operationids-pascal-case.description: Operation IDs MUST be written in PascalCase.

operations-summary-length.description: Operation summary should be short and sweet, no full stops, and less than 20 characters

operations-summary-period-none.description: Summary should not have a trailing period

operations-summary-words-check.description: Must not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

operations-tags-one.description: Must have at least one tag.

parameters-default-not-allowed.description: A required parameter should not specify a default value.

parameters-description-length.description: The description can't be more than 20 characters.

parameters-description-word-check.description: Must not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

parameters-description.description: Must not contain specific words, including REST, Public, and Developer.

parameters-name-camel-case.description: Path and query parmeters must use camelCase.

paths-base-api-none.description: SHOULD not use /api as base path.

paths-lowercase-hyphens.message: Path segments have to be lowercase separate words with hyphens
paths-lowercase-hyphens.description: MUST use lowercase separate words with hyphens for path segments

paths-no-empty.message: Empty path segments are not allowed
paths-no-empty.description: There should be no empty path segments.

paths-limit-number-of.description: SHOULD limit number of resource types [146]

paths-subresources-limit-number-of.description: SHOULD limit number of sub-resource levels [147]

paths-trailing-slash-none.message: Path with trailing slash is not allowed
paths-trailing-slash-none.description: All paths must not end with a trailing slash.

paths-trailing-slash.message: Path with trailing slash is not allowed
paths-trailing-slash.description: All paths must end with a trailing slash.

produces-mime-type-oas2.description: FHIR mime-type must be application/fhir+(xml|json|turtle) or application/x-www-form-urlencoded for search endpoints

OAS do not allow using the following HTTP headers in a specification
file Authorization, Content-Type and Accept. You MUST use the associate functionalities provided by OAS, instead.

request-headers-accept.description: FHIR v4.0 is the prefered version

request-headers-cache-control-documented.description: Cache usage SHOULD be extensively detailed in the description propertyto avoid data leaks or the dusage of stale data.This rule should ensure in some way that the api providerdocumented extensively the cache usage to avoid data leaksor usage of stale data.For now this ruleset tests* the presence of following keywords  in the description max-age, private, no-store, no-cache.* that one and only one between Expires and  Cache-Control is used.Cache-Control and Expires should not be used in conjuction,because Cache-Control overrides Expires when max-age is set.Instead if neither Cache-Control or Expires are set, clients MAY use euristic cachelike described in RFC7234.√•
request-headers-cache-control-documented.message: Cache usage SHOULD be documented when used.

request-headers-cache-responses-indeterm.description: Cache usage SHOULD be extensively detailed in the description propertyto avoid data leaks or the usage of stale data.This rule should ensure in some way that the api providerdocumented extensively the cache usage to avoid data leaksor usage of stale data.For now this ruleset tests* the presence of following keywords  in the description max-age, private, no-store, no-cache.* that one and only one between Expires and Cache-Control is used.Cache-Control and Expires should not be used in conjuction,because Cache-Control overrides Expires when max-age is set.Instead if neither Cache-Control or Expires are set, clients MAY use euristic cachelike described in RFC7234.

Headers should be pascal-case.

See Italian recommendation RAC_REST_NAME_003.

security-protection-get.description: Your API should be protected by a `security` rule either at global or operation level. Operations should be protected specially when they are tied to non-idempotent HTTP methods like `POST`, `PUT`, `PATCH` and `DELETE`. This is done with one or more non-empty `security` rules. Security rules are defined in the `securityScheme` section. An example of a security rule applied at global level.
security-protection-get.message: The following operation is not protected by a `security` rule: {{path}}

security-protection-non-idempotent.description: Your API should be protected by a `security` rule either at global or operation level. Operations should be protected specially when they are tied to non-idempotent HTTP methods like `POST`, `PUT`, `PATCH` and `DELETE`. This is done with one or more non-empty `security` rules. Security rules are defined in the `securityScheme` section. An example of a security rule applied at global level.
security-protection-non-idempotent.message: The following non-idempotent operation is not protected by a `security` rule: {{path}}

security-schemes-jwt.description: Json Web Tokens RFC7519 is a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties. JWT can be enclosed in encrypted or signed tokens like JWS and JWE.
security-schemes-jwt.message: JWT usage should be detailed in `description` {{error}}.

security-schemes-oauth-allowed-flows.description: The OAuth2 authorization framework defines various [grant types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3), most notably the [AuthorizationCode](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.1) and the [Client Credentials](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.4). Some grant types are now considered insecure and MUST not be used, including `implicit` and `password`. The new [OAuth2.1](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-1-01)  still in draft, removes them and suggests to replace the `implicit` with `authorizationCode` + PKCE defined in RFC7636.
security-schemes-oauth-allowed-flows.message: Do not use oauth2 insecure flow: "{{property}}".

securitySchemes-jwt.description: Json Web Tokens RFC7519 is a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties. JWT can be enclosed in encrypted or signed tokens like JWS and JWE. The [JOSE IANA registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/jose/jose.xhtml) provides algorithms information. RFC8725 describes common pitfalls in the JWx specifications and in their implementations.
securitySchemes-jwt.message: JWT usage should be detailed in `description` {{error}}.

securitySchemes-oauth-allowed-flows.description: The OAuth2 authorization framework defines various [grant types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3), most notably the [AuthorizationCode](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.1) and the [Client Credentials](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.4). Some grant types are now considered insecure and MUST not be used, including `implicit` and `password`. The new [OAuth2.1](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-1-01)  still in draft, removes them and suggests to replace the `implicit` with `authorizationCode` + PKCE defined in RFC7636.
securitySchemes-oauth-allowed-flows.message: Do not use oauth2 insecure flow: "{{property}}".

securitySchemes-oauth.description: Json Web Tokens RFC7519 is a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties. JWT can be enclosed in encrypted or signed tokens like JWS and JWE. The [JOSE IANA registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/jose/jose.xhtml) provides algorithms information. RFC8725 describes common pitfalls in the JWx specifications and in their implementations.
securitySchemes-oauth.message: JWT usage should be detailed in `description` {{error}}.

servers-must-exist-oas3.description: OpenAPI servers must be present and non-empty array.

servers-url-mock-oas3.description: Mock API server must be the first one so that Postman import uses it.

servers-use-https.description:
Servers must use https to ensure the origin of the responses
and protect the integrity and the  confidentiality of the communication.

You can use `http://` only on sandboxes environment.
Use `x-sandbox: true` to skip this kind of check.
servers-use-https.message: Non-sandbox url  {{value}} {{error}}. Add `x-sandbox: true` to skip this check on a specific server.

string-pattern-or-format-or-enum.description: String length should be limited to avoid an attacker to send very long strings to your service.
string-pattern-or-format-or-enum.message: Strings (non enum) must specify a pattern or a format. {{path}}

tags-one.description: Must have at least one tag.

unknown-error-format.description: Every error response SHOULD support either RFC 7807 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6648) or the JSON:API Error format.

use-problem-json-for-errors.description: Error management is a key enabler of a resilient API ecosystem. Enforcing a consistent schema for errors between different APIs, enables client to properly implement an error management strategy, with positive impacts for users.
use-problem-json-for-errors.message: Error responses should support RFC7807 in {{path}}.

version-date-format.message: Specs should follow inception date based versioning eg. 2020-01-01. {{value}} is not a valid version.

version-query-parameter-oas2.description: Specify API version using api-version query parameter, not in path.

version-segment-second.description: The second path segment should be a whole-number version like v1.

allowed-currency-format.description: currency must fit the ISO standard
